title: How to Play What's the Time Mr Wolf

steps.headline: Assemble the children against the wall in a line.
Choose "Mr. Wolf" (star of the day).
steps.description: Ask Mr. Wolf to stand at one end of the playing area.

steps.headline: Play the game:
Change Mr. Wolf.
steps.description: The child who was the wolf can choose another person (opposite gender) to be the next wolf.

text:
Assemble the children against the wall in a line. Choose "Mr. Wolf" (star of the day). Ask Mr. Wolf to stand at one end of the playing area. Play the game: Mr Wolf turns his or her back so he/she cannot see the kids. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet1-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/1/1f/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet1-Version-2.jpg/aid77669-v4-728px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The row of children chant:{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet2-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/e6/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet2-Version-2.jpg/aid77669-v4-728px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} "What's the time Mr. Wolf?" Mr. Wolf will turn around and answer a time (for example, 4 o'clock). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/c/c7/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/aid77669-v4-728px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The children advance the number of steps called out and then repeat the chant, waiting for a response and so on. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/9/9e/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet4.jpg/aid77669-v4-728px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Eventually they will be standing very close to Mr. Wolf. Mr. Wolf can, at any moment once the line of children is close, respond "Lunch Time" in a loud growl, instead of giving a real time. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/67/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet5-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet5-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/67/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet5-Version-2.jpg/aid77669-v4-728px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet5-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} This is the cue for lots of screaming (remind them not to scream) and running because now Mr. Wolf has to chase the rest of the children and tag one of them. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet6-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet6-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/8/8f/Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet6-Version-2.jpg/aid77669-v4-728px-Play-What%27s-the-Time-Mr-Wolf-Step-3Bullet6-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Change Mr. Wolf. The child who was the wolf can choose another person (opposite gender) to be the next wolf.
sentences: Assemble the children against the wall in a line.
Ask Mr. Wolf to stand at one end of the playing area.
Play the game: Mr Wolf turns his or her back so he/she cannot see the kids.
